lines.text: Enter MACBETH

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Why should I play the Roman fool, and die On mine own sword whiles I see lives, the gashes Do better upon them.
Enter MACDUFF

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Turn, hellhound, turn!

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Of all men else I have avoided thee: But get thee back my soul is too much charged With blood of thine already.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: I have no words: My voice is in my sword: thou bloodier villain Than terms can give thee out!
They fight

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Thou losest labour: As easy mayst thou the intrenchant air With thy keen sword impress as make me bleed: Let fall thy blade on vulnerable crests I bear a charmed life, which must not yield, To one of woman born.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Despair thy charm And let the angel whom thou still hast served Tell thee, Macduff was from his mothers womb Untimely rippd.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Accursed be that tongue that tells me so, For it hath cowd my better part of man! And be these juggling fiends no more believed, That palter with us in a double sense That keep the word of promise to our ear, And break it to our hope. Ill not fight with thee.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Then yield thee, coward, And live to be the show and gaze o the time: Well have thee, as our rarer monsters are, Painted on a pole, and underwrit, Here may you see the tyrant.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: I will not yield, To kiss the ground before young Malcolms feet, And to be baited with the rabbles curse. Though Birnam wood be come to Dunsinane, And thou opposed, being of no woman born, Yet I will try the last. Before my body I throw my warlike shield. Lay on, Macduff, And damnd be him that first cries, Hold, enough!
Exeunt, fighting. Alarums
Retreat. Flourish. Enter, with drum and colours, MALCOLM, SIWARD, ROSS, the other Thanes, and Soldiers

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: I would the friends we miss were safe arrived.

lines.speaker: siward
lines.text: Some must go off: and yet, by these I see, So great a day as this is cheaply bought.

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: Macduff is missing, and your noble son.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Your son, my lord, has paid a soldiers debt: He only lived but till he was a man The which no sooner had his prowess confirmd In the unshrinking station where he fought, But like a man he died.

lines.speaker: siward
lines.text: Then he is dead

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ay, and brought off the field: your cause of sorrow Must not be measured by his worth, for then It hath no end.

lines.speaker: siward
lines.text: Had he his hurts before

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ay, on the front.

lines.speaker: siward
lines.text: Why then, Gods soldier be he! Had I as many sons as I have hairs, I would not wish them to a fairer death: And so, his knell is knolld.

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: Hes worth more sorrow, And that Ill spend for him.

lines.speaker: siward
lines.text: Hes worth no more They say he parted well, and paid his score: And so, God be with him! Here comes newer comfort.
Reenter MACDUFF, with MACBETHs head

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Hail, king! for so thou art: behold, where stands The usurpers cursed head: the time is free: I see thee compassd with thy kingdoms pearl, That speak my salutation in their minds Whose voices I desire aloud with mine: Hail, King of Scotland!

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Hail, King of Scotland!
Flourish

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: We shall not spend a large expense of time Before we reckon with your several loves, And make us even with you. My thanes and kinsmen, Henceforth be earls, the first that ever Scotland In such an honour named. Whats more to do, Which would be planted newly with the time, As calling home our exiled friends abroad That fled the snares of watchful tyranny Producing forth the cruel ministers Of this dead butcher and his fiendlike queen, Who, as tis thought, by self and violent hands Took off her life this, and what needful else That calls upon us, by the grace of Grace, We will perform in measure, time and place: So, thanks to all at once and to each one, Whom we invite to see us crownd at Scone.
Flourish. Exeunt
